name: Antiquated Battle Droid

sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Assassin Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Edge of the Empire Core\Droids\Assassin Droid - Nemesis.xml
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Assassin droids are designed to kill living creatures, with an array of weaponry and the programming to use it all. They are often used by criminal enterprises and the Empire to huntdown the hardest of targets.

name: Astromech Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Edge of the Empire Core\Droids\Astromech Droid - Rival.xml
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Common throughout the galaxy, and existing in a variety of models (notably the R-series of droids), they are used for astrogation first and foremost. Effectively a replacement for a navicomputer, they were soon developed to double as on-board mechanics and maintenance droids.

name: Protocol Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 410 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
adv_import_path: Edge of the Empire Core\Droids\Protocol Droid - Rival.xml
description: Produced to solve the problem of having an innumerable number of languages and species across the galaxy in need of communication, the protocol droid is shipped with suites to properly engage in the etiquette of each culture.

name: Maintenance Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Edge of the Empire Core\Droids\Maintenance Droid - Minion.xml
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
description: Serving as a replacement for living laborers on starports and starships, these droids are used only for the most basic grunt work and maintenance jobs.

name: Security Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Edge of the Empire Core\Droids\Security Droid - Rival.xml
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

name: Medical Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 410 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.
sources: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook
adv_import_path: Edge of the Empire Core\Droids\Medical Droid - Rival.xml
description: Produced in a variety of models, they largely all operate in the same way - providing rudimentary medical skills to facilities without the need for a trained specialist.

name: Analysis Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Force and Destiny Core\Droids\Analysis Droid - Minion.xml
description: Manufactured by most droid producers, an analysis droid often operates as part of a group. They are little more than networked droid brains capable of high processing speed.

name: IG-100 Magnaguard Droid
reference: Please see page 409 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Force and Destiny Core\Droids\IG-100 Magnaguard - Nemesis.xml

name: Interrogation Droid
reference: Please see page 410 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Force and Destiny Core\Droids\Interrogation Droid - Rival.xml
description: Interrogation droids are used almost exclusively by the Empire, designed to be floating black spheres with the capacity to torture and ultimately pull the deepest secrets from their targets.

name: Viper Probe Droid
reference: Please see page 410 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook for details.
adv_import_path: Force and Destiny Core\Droids\Viper Probe Droid - Rival.xml
description: The Viper series probe droid designed by Arakyd Industries, it is often sent out by scout vessels and larger cruisers to survey thousands of planets using one-way hyperspace pods.
